metadata.synopsis: Default dialogue - the conversation you can have with Shadowheart at any time when she's a member of your party. You can ask her about herself, or events that you've experienced together during your adventures. Her responses to you may differ slightly depending on her current attitude towards you.

16.speaker: Shadowheart
16.text: You've already pestered me with your notions once today. If I have something to add, I'll tell you.
16.context: InternalNodeContext: The player already attempted persuades today - there's no more attempts available until after rest.

14.speaker: Shadowheart
14.text: You've already pestered me with your notions once today. If I have something to add, I'll tell you.
14.context: InternalNodeContext: The player already attempted persuades today - there's no more attempts available until after rest.

100.speaker: Shadowheart
100.text: This again? You're persistent, I'll give you that.

104.speaker: Shadowheart
104.text: I'm not sure I'd agree, but very well. What do you want to know?
104.context: NodeContext: Skeptical. Fellow cleric of a different god is expressing interest in her faith.

230.speaker: Shadowheart
230.text: I'm not sure I'd agree, but very well. What do you want to know?
230.context: NodeContext: Skeptical. Fellow cleric of a different god is expressing interest in her faith.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: Humour me. Tell me what your Lady Shar means to you.
192.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowed headNodeContext: A prayer, spoken gently, intimately. This is between her, the player and their goddess

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: What, Shar's tenets? If you like...

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Your goddess is blessed to have such an eloquent servant. Please, show me how you pray to her.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: Inspiring. But what of those who stand against your goddess? How do you sway them?

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Your goddess is blessed to have such an eloquent servant. Please, show me how you pray to her.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I wish to bear witness to a prayer dedicated to the Nightsinger.
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowed headNodeContext: A prayer, spoken gently, intimately. This is between her, the player and their goddess

181.speaker: Shadowheart
181.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowed headNodeContext: A prayer, spoken gently, intimately. This is between her, the player and their goddess

160.speaker: Shadowheart
160.text: Blessed Nightsinger, witness our adoration. See how we serve you, only you.
160.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowed headNodeContext: A prayer, spoken gently, intimately. This is between her, the player and their goddess

121.speaker: Shadowheart
121.text: We have emptied our hearts of falsehoods. We have vanquished your foes. In the darkness, we see your truth.
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowed headNodeContext: A prayer, spoken gently, intimately. This is between her, the player and their goddess

139.speaker: Shadowheart
139.text: Embrace us, your loyal warriors. Cloak us in your shadow. Guide us to your victory.
139.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowed headNodeContext: A prayer, spoken gently, intimately. This is between her, the player and their goddess

223.speaker: Shadowheart
223.text: Shar's will shall be done. As sure as night will fall.
223.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raises her head, strong eye contact on player.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: You pray with such conviction. The presence of your goddess must fill your whole being.
30.context: NodeContext: A little hint of guardedness in this line - in truth, she does not feel her goddess answering her prayers right now.

149.speaker: Shadowheart
149.text: ... yes. I am honoured with her blessing.
149.context: NodeContext: A little hint of guardedness in this line - in truth, she does not feel her goddess answering her prayers right now.

228.speaker: Player
228.text: Tell me - what of those who oppose your Dark Lady? How do you seek to sway them?

113.speaker: Shadowheart
113.text: Not this again. I told you already - forget it.
113.context: InternalNodeContext: This active roll is available after the branch is unlocked by one of several events that can trigger in Act 1. It remains available until it is attempted or Shadowheart's Shar Worship is revealed via other means.

23.speaker: Shadowheart
23.text: Not this again. I told you already - forget it.
23.context: InternalNodeContext: This active roll is available after the branch is unlocked by one of several events that can trigger in Act 1. It remains available until it is attempted or Shadowheart's Shar Worship is revealed via other means.

85.speaker: Shadowheart
85.text: I don't know what you mean.
85.context: InternalNodeContext: This active roll is available after the branch is unlocked by one of several events that can trigger in Act 1. It remains available until it is attempted or Shadowheart's Shar Worship is revealed via other means.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: That ruined Selûne statue - it made you hesitate.
9.context: InternalNodeContext: This active roll is available after the branch is unlocked by one of several events that can trigger in Act 1. It remains available until it is attempted or Shadowheart's Shar Worship is revealed via other means.

47.speaker: Shadowheart
47.context: InternalNodeContext: This active roll is available after the branch is unlocked by one of several events that can trigger in Act 1. It remains available until it is attempted or Shadowheart's Shar Worship is revealed via other means.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: We have to be honest with each other. What is it you're keeping from me?
175.context: InternalNodeContext: This active roll is available after the branch is unlocked by one of several events that can trigger in Act 1. It remains available until it is attempted or Shadowheart's Shar Worship is revealed via other means.

50.speaker: Shadowheart
50.text: You're not going to let this go, are you? You might wish you had...
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

80.speaker: Shadowheart
80.text: You're not going to let this go, are you? You might wish you had...
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

36.speaker: Shadowheart
36.text: I worship Shar, the Mistress of the Night. It is my holy mission to oppose Selûne, her teachings and her followers.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

197.speaker: Shadowheart
197.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Don't make a fuss, Selûnite - we may be at odds, but I have more important concerns than you right now.
1.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

43.speaker: Shadowheart
43.text: Don't make a fuss, Selûnite - we may be at odds, but I have more important concerns than you right now.
43.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

88.speaker: Shadowheart
88.text: Now that you have the truth, please don't make a big fuss about it.
88.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I'll decide whether to make a fuss or not. Hard to trust someone who's holding out on me.
22.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

51.speaker: Shadowheart
51.text: Secrecy is everything for Shar's children. It's our code, our creed, our shield.
51.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

8.speaker: Shadowheart
8.text: I even keep secrets from myself - I had my memories suppressed, so that nothing I knew could be used against the Dark Lady. Once I prove myself, my memories will be restored.
8.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

12.speaker: Shadowheart
12.text: I'm not sorry I kept this from you. Not one bit.

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.text: Though perhaps that might change, if you can show an open mind.
5.context: NodeContext: Conceding jus a little towards the player's hurt feelings - but conditionally

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Let's see how open-minded I can be then: tell me more.
115.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

54.speaker: Player
54.text: We can discuss this later. But let's just try a little more honesty going forward.
54.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

28.speaker: Shadowheart
28.text: All we can do is try, I suppose...

201.speaker: Player
201.text: I don't know how I feel about this.
201.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

37.speaker: Shadowheart
37.text: Who says you have to feel anything?

138.speaker: Shadowheart
138.text: Gather your thoughts. Then perhaps we can talk some more.

225.speaker: Player
225.text: Thank you for telling me, at least.
225.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

127.speaker: Shadowheart
127.text: Don't thank me - I'm breaking Lady Shar's teachings just by doing so... but sometimes you have to be practical.
127.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Don't make a big fuss...? You've been lying to me!

92.speaker: Shadowheart
92.text: A lie of omission at most. I'm sure you have some skeletons of your own hidden away.

235.speaker: Player
235.text: You could have told me. How long were you going to keep this secret?

111.speaker: Shadowheart
111.text: Forever, ideally. And you assume too much about what I can and cannot tell.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: I didn't agree to join up with a Shar worshipper.

136.speaker: Shadowheart
136.text: Then it's your own fault for not asking.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Now that the truth's out, tell me more.

69.speaker: Shadowheart
69.text: All right. As I said, Shar is my patron, my mistress. Goddess of darkness and loss.

198.speaker: Player
198.text: It's been some time since I met another faithful of Shar. Are you versed in her teachings?

234.speaker: Shadowheart
234.text: What kind of question is that? Of course I am. Are you?

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Naturally. We can discuss the Dark Lady another time.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: In future, I expect you to be honest. Let's leave it at that for now.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I can't trust you. Best if we travel separately for now.

196.speaker: Shadowheart
196.text: If you insist. Don't expect to fare well without me to save you.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I don't care who you worship. We have bigger problems.

72.speaker: Shadowheart
72.text: True. I didn't think you'd react so pragmatically. Perhaps I should have told you sooner.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Shar is an abomination. You deceived me.

224.speaker: Shadowheart
224.text: Your blindness as much as my deception, Selûnite. We can talk about this later - if you're willing.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I bow to Shar also. The Dark Lady must favour us, to have brought us together.

11.speaker: Shadowheart
11.text: I... yes, she must. I'll offer thanks to her in my prayers - and we should speak more later. Alone, ideally.

210.speaker: Player
210.text: I worship Lolth - your secret does not shock me. I've seen and done so much worse.

155.text: What makes you think I'm hiding anything? If I've something to share, I'll let you know.

130.speaker: Shadowheart
130.text: What makes you think I'm hiding anything? If I've something to share, I'll let you know.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Tell me what you're hiding, or else.
49.context: InternalNodeContext: This active roll is available after the branch is unlocked by one of several events that can trigger in Act 1. It remains available until it is attempted or Shadowheart's Shar Worship is revealed via other means.

52.speaker: Shadowheart
52.text: Fine, I'll tell you, so long as it spares me your ham-fisted threats.

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: Fine, I'll tell you, so long as it spares me your ham-fisted threats.

184.text: Spare me the bluster and threats. If I have something to tell you, I'll tell you.

20.speaker: Shadowheart
20.text: Spare me the bluster and threats. If I have something to tell you, I'll tell you.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Tell me what you're hiding. Now.
61.context: InternalNodeContext: This roll should be available after a day oneroll has been failed. It should have a lower DC than day One.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: We can't afford to keep secrets from each other. What are you hiding?
194.context: InternalNodeContext: This roll should be available after a day oneroll has been failed. It should have a lower DC than day One.

219.text: Like I told you before; you'll know if I have anything to tell you.

135.speaker: Shadowheart
135.text: Like I told you before; you'll know if I have anything to tell you.

55.speaker: Shadowheart
55.text: What, not trying to threaten a confession out of me this time? You'll know if I have anything to tell you.

178.speaker: Player
178.text: Seriously, tell me whatever it is you're hiding or there'll be consequences.
178.context: InternalNodeContext: This roll should be available after a day oneroll has been failed. It should have a lower DC than day One.

81.text: What, now you're resorting to threats? The answer's the same as before - you'll know if I have anything to tell you.

78.speaker: Shadowheart
78.text: What, now you're resorting to threats? The answer's the same as before - you'll know if I have anything to tell you.

48.speaker: Shadowheart
48.text: More hot air and empty threats. When I want you to know something, I'll tell you.

213.speaker: Player
213.text: Whatever secret you're guarding, you can tell me. We need to trust each other.

166.text: You're persistent; I'll give you that. But I'll decide what I share, or don't.

220.speaker: Shadowheart
220.text: You're persistent; I'll give you that. But I'll decide what I share, or don't.

179.speaker: Shadowheart
179.text: Not a fast learner, are you? My affairs are my own; I won't be coerced by you.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Tell me what you're hiding. I can make you talk if I have to.

164.text: What makes you think threats will get you what you want? I've nothing to say to you.

206.speaker: Shadowheart
206.text: What makes you think threats will get you what you want? I've nothing to say to you.

142.speaker: Shadowheart
142.text: Are you sure? You've utterly failed so far. If I have something to tell you, I'll do so when I want to.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: That helmeted skeleton we found in the village - there's something you're hiding about it.
39.context: InternalNodeContext: Fallback question node in case this line of questioning is available but a specific QN referring to a prior situation didn't trigger.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: That diary we found in Moonhaven - it meant something to you, I know it.
109.context: InternalNodeContext: Fallback question node in case this line of questioning is available but a specific QN referring to a prior situation didn't trigger.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: When we found that Selûne shrine in the cave - you reacted unusually.
102.context: InternalNodeContext: Fallback question node in case this line of questioning is available but a specific QN referring to a prior situation didn't trigger.

231.speaker: Player
231.text: When we entered the old temple of Selûne - you reacted unusually.
231.context: InternalNodeContext: Fallback question node in case this line of questioning is available but a specific QN referring to a prior situation didn't trigger.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: No, I think you know exactly what I mean.
59.context: InternalNodeContext: Fallback question node in case this line of questioning is available but a specific QN referring to a prior situation didn't trigger.

133.speaker: Shadowheart
133.text: You truly will not give up, will you? I admire your tenacity, if not your powers of persuasion...
133.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH approves of the player for a minimum of tenNodeContext: Uncomfortable/a little torn. The player's prying into a personal matter (at the same time, she doesn't have a terrible opinion of them)

137.speaker: Shadowheart
137.text: You truly will not give up, will you? I admire your tenacity, if not your powers of persuasion...
137.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH approves of the player for a minimum of tenNodeContext: Uncomfortable/a little torn. The player's prying into a personal matter (at the same time, she doesn't have a terrible opinion of them)

208.speaker: Shadowheart
208.text: You truly will not give up, will you? I admire your tenacity, if not your powers of persuasion...

140.speaker: Shadowheart
140.text: All right... you've suffered enough for me to risk a little candour.

214.speaker: Shadowheart
214.text: I'm sure you do. But please try to understand that it's not something I can just talk about freely.
214.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH approves of the player for a minimum of tenNodeContext: Uncomfortable/a little torn. The player's prying into a personal matter (at the same time, she doesn't have a terrible opinion of them)

199.speaker: Shadowheart
199.text: I'm sure you do. But please try to understand that it's not something I can just talk about freely.
199.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH approves of the player for a minimum of tenNodeContext: Uncomfortable/a little torn. The player's prying into a personal matter (at the same time, she doesn't have a terrible opinion of them)

45.speaker: Shadowheart
45.text: You're straight to the point, at least. But still, I'm not sure you are ready for Shar's teachings. Not yet, at least.
45.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if SH's approval is greater than 0, less than 10

105.speaker: Shadowheart
105.text: I don't have to explain myself to you.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: I might have to reconsider travelling with you if you keep secrets from me.

187.speaker: Shadowheart
187.text: Then reconsider, if you're sure you can survive without me.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: My apologies. I didn't mean to pry.

147.speaker: Shadowheart
147.text: Fine. Just keep out matters that don't concern you.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I have no problems with Shar worshippers, if that's what concerns you.

34.speaker: Shadowheart
34.text: Very well. Perhaps there's potential in you. Let's see how you handle this.

117.speaker: Shadowheart
117.text: Very well. Perhaps there's potential in you. Let's see how you handle this.

97.speaker: Shadowheart
97.text: I am indeed a disciple of Shar - Mistress of the Night and Lady of Loss.

163.speaker: Shadowheart
163.text: As you worship Selûne, I assume you know of her twin?

33.speaker: Shadowheart
33.text: I assume you've heard of her?

18.speaker: Shadowheart
18.text: My Lady Shar is the Nightsinger. The patron of darkness and loss.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Sounds like a miserable realm of influence for a deity to hold.

183.speaker: Shadowheart
183.text: Hrmph. Only if you lack foresight and imagination.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Honestly, your faith is your own concern. I won't judge, one way or the other.

202.speaker: Player
202.text: She doesn't sound very appealing, going by her titles.

114.speaker: Shadowheart
114.text: The night brings comfort. Through loss, we find acceptance. In the arms of the Dark Mother we find peace.

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: Most fear the dark, like children, because in darkness they see their fears reflected.

165.speaker: Shadowheart
165.text: But Shar teaches us to step beyond fear. Beyond loss. In darkness we do not hide - we act.

86.speaker: Shadowheart
86.text: Pain. Hope. The promise of better days. All of these are heavy cloaks that bend our backs and burden our hearts.

95.speaker: Shadowheart
95.text: We shed those cloaks. Before Shar we stand gloriously naked, beyond the vanities of mortals.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: Sounds... daunting. I don't think it's for me.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: How exactly do Shar worshippers turn people to their goddess?

168.speaker: Player
168.text: When you put it like that, it seems strangely comforting.

24.speaker: Shadowheart
24.text: There's comfort, yes. But often there has to be pain beforehand...

182.speaker: Shadowheart
182.text: We tear down the lies the world is drunk on: the institutions they trust, the so-called gods they worship. The lives they cling to.

87.speaker: Shadowheart
87.text: We destroy false idols, topple corrupt organisations, fight heretics wherever they're found.

207.speaker: Shadowheart
207.text: There's often suffering - death even. Many people break before they embrace Shar's truths.

71.speaker: Shadowheart
71.text: Well if that troubles you, perhaps you should fetch the bailiff to arrest me...

38.speaker: Shadowheart
38.text: ...ah, but there's no bailiff here, is there? Just leagues of wilderness and the dangers lurking within.

151.speaker: Shadowheart
151.text: We're in this together, but I'll happily go it alone. My faith will keep me company.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: I won't cast judgement on your beliefs.

93.speaker: Shadowheart
93.text: Curious. Most are afraid of my Lady.

32.speaker: Shadowheart
32.text: I think I did well by joining you. Most agreeable company.

173.speaker: Shadowheart
173.text: Perhaps you'll turn out to be a worthy companion after all.

73.speaker: Shadowheart
73.text: I didn't expect to see eye to eye with you on this. A pleasant surprise, I'll admit.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: I'd be lying if I said it didn't sound convincing. You should tell me more some time.

156.speaker: Shadowheart
156.text: You're wiser than most. Many people balk at our doctrine - it's the reason why we cherish secrecy.

65.speaker: Shadowheart
65.text: You've a habit of saying all the right things. Either you're very glib or we're kindred spirits.

3.speaker: Shadowheart
3.text: Maybe both, knowing myself. But yes. Once we've saved ourselves, we can talk more on this.

107.speaker: Shadowheart
107.text: You surprise me. And not in a negative sense, I must admit.

79.speaker: Shadowheart
79.text: You surprise me - pleasantly. Perhaps I misjudged you.

185.speaker: Shadowheart
185.text: Perhaps once we've saved ourselves from the tadpoles, we can talk more on this.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: There has to be something more that draws people to Shar.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: I've heard Shar worship is vilified by many - forbidden outright in parts.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: You should trust me. We're in the same boat, after all.

233.speaker: Shadowheart
233.text: I had hoped you might be tactful enough to not pick at that particular scab. Seems I was mistaken.
233.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

108.speaker: Shadowheart
108.text: I had hoped you might be tactful enough to not pick at that particular scab. Seems I was mistaken.
108.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

162.speaker: Shadowheart
162.text: My Lady and your moonwitch are at war, so naturally we're enemies... but enemies with a common purpose, for now.
162.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

152.speaker: Shadowheart
152.text: As long as we have use for each other, I can bite my tongue and stay my blade. I don't see what more needs to be said on the matter.
152.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: We have a chance to understand each other - don't you at least want to try?
57.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

153.speaker: Shadowheart
153.text: I suppose some would consider such diplomacy a virtue. Others might just see it as a lack of will.
153.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

171.speaker: Shadowheart
171.text: But I suppose there's no harm in learning about the opposition - though I doubt there's much to learn. You Selûnites are coddled, decadent, drunk on hope. Fattened calves, ready for sacrifice.
171.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: I think you know that's not true. I think you know more about the Moonmaiden than you realise...
145.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

118.speaker: Shadowheart
118.text: Is this because of what I shared with you? My memory of being saved from the wolf? You're clutching at straws.
118.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

99.speaker: Shadowheart
99.text: We've spoken enough of this. I cannot allow your misguided beliefs to poison my mind.
99.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: We are far from coddled. All children of Selûne cherish self-reliance. From a young age, we need to fend for ourselves.
120.context: NodeContext: Derisive. Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

110.speaker: Shadowheart
110.text: How so? Are you taught to churn your own butter while barely out of swaddling?
110.context: NodeContext: Derisive. Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

116.speaker: Shadowheart
116.text: Nothing Selûne asks of you can compare to the tests that Lady Shar's children endure.
116.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Not so. Our youngest are left to fend for themselves in the deepest wilds. They need to survive and navigate home using the Moonmaiden's guiding light.
15.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed, but giving way to some deja vu disquiet in the back half (this will foreshadow her backstory and abduction as a child). Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

35.speaker: Shadowheart
35.text: What, you think frolicking in the woods by moonlight amounts to a test? That's nothing. That's just... a childish thing. I don't want to hear any more of it.
35.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed, but giving way to some deja vu disquiet in the back half (this will foreshadow her backstory and abduction as a child). Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: You cannot know for certain. We each walk our own path. Shar, Selûne... nobody can know both.
128.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

40.speaker: Shadowheart
40.text: Trust me, I am endlessly grateful to not know Selûne.
40.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

125.speaker: Player
125.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

229.speaker: Shadowheart
229.text: If you're attempting to goad me, don't bother. I'm more than familiar with those sort of tricks.
229.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

217.speaker: Player
217.text: Let's agree to disagree. This may not be the healthiest topic for us.
217.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

83.speaker: Shadowheart
83.text: That may be the wisest thing you've ever said.
83.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Our goddesses are twins - part of a whole. We complement each other.
193.context: NodeContext: Backhanded compliment to someone she respects in one sense but is rivalled by in another sense. Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

27.speaker: Shadowheart
27.text: You're good company - I'll admit it. I'm sorry you're hindered by that supposed goddess.
27.context: NodeContext: Backhanded compliment to someone she respects in one sense but is rivalled by in another sense. Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

76.speaker: Shadowheart
76.text: But whatever you and I think of each other means little. We stand in opposition - our goddesses have determined it.
76.context: NodeContext: Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

203.speaker: Shadowheart
203.text: You're better company than I would expect, for a Selûnite. Don't let it go to your head, though.
203.context: NodeContext: Backhanded compliment to someone she respects in one sense but is rivalled by in another sense. Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

96.speaker: Shadowheart
96.text: Like oil complements an open flame, perhaps.
96.context: NodeContext: Droll, unconvinced. Verbal sparring with a Selune-worshipping player. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: Perhaps you're right. I'll leave the matter rest.
